name: Simple and Flavorful Salisbury Steak
author: Kaye Lynn
summary: This is a simple and flavorful recipe for an old standby. The sauce makes wonderful gravy to serve over the meat or mashed potatoes.
ingredients: 1 (1 ounce) package dry onion soup mix
salt and ground black pepper to taste
1 (10.75 ounce) can  cream of mushroom soup
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Mix ground beef, eggs, bread crumbs, dry soup mix, salt, and pepper together in a large bowl; add about 1/2 the can of beef broth and continue mixing until beef mixture is thoroughly moistened
Divide mixture into six portions and shape into patties
Heat a Dutch oven over medium heat
Brown patties in the hot pot, 3 to 5 minutes per side
Spoon excess grease from the pot
Stir remaining beef broth with cream of mushroom soup and dry mustard in a bowl until smooth; pour over the browned patties
Bake in preheated oven until patties are no longer pink in the center, about 45 minutes
An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 160 degrees F (70 degrees C)
